name: Laplacian Edge Sharpness
description: Analyzes Laplacian edge response distribution to detect suppressed high-frequency edge detail characteristic of AI-generated images.
mechanism: Applies Laplacian kernel to detect edges and measures the statistical distribution of edge responses. AI images often show suppressed high-frequency responses due to implicit smoothing in generation process.
parameters: Kernel: 3×3 Laplacian, Metrics: mean, variance, kurtosis of |response|, Threshold: adaptive
source: Wang, Z. et al. (2004) — Image Quality Assessment, IEEE TIP; Marziliano, P. et al. (2002)
useCase: Detecting unnatural edge sharpness profiles in AI content

references.title: Wang, Z. et al. (2004). Image Quality Assessment. IEEE TIP.

strengths:
• Fast computation
• Captures edge quality objectively
• Based on well-known operators
• Good complementary edge signal
limitations:
• Sensitive to JPEG compression
• Cannot distinguish AI from post-processing
• Image resolution affects results
• Some AI models generate sharp edges
